content.description:
Slingin' the Chicken is 5.9. It has 6 bolts and 2 single ring anchors.

Per

Thomas Cuthbert

: this is a route up the left side of the rock with fun foot work, the crux is at the top.
content.location:
This is on the left side of this small crag.  It has a fun mini-roof to anchors.

Per

Thomas Cuthbert

: it is the leftmost bolted climb of the three routes.

content.description: Lil Ruff is a short, fun route that is probably around 5.7 until the crux which is getting over the small roof. Power through using slightly crimpy holds to a good sidepull below the anchors.
content.location: This is the left route on the rightmost wall in the Chocolate Tower area.

content.description:
The crux is up high.

Per

Thomas Cuthbert

: this is an awesome route high up above the train tracks. It has a sweet overhang with the crux at the top. There is a little bit of guano on one of the holds though.
content.location:
It is on the pillar above the second tunnel (just south from Chocolate Tower). Park on CR-371 just before the first tunnel and walk around on the track side.

Per

Thomas Cuthbert

: you can see the rock poking out when approaching the tunnels, there is a path leading to the route from the left of the road.

content.description: Dog Tail is a short, fun route that has an interesting move at crux right below the bulge.
content.location: This is the right route on the rightmost wall in the Chocolate Tower area.

content.description:
This is in the middle of the wall.  It is trad/sport, but as of 4/3/13, the 2 bolts have no hangers (now replaced). There are fixed anchors up top.

Per

Thomas Cuthbert

: it has good holds. There are some tricky moves close to the top at the roof, but it ends with an easy finish.
content.protection:
Bring small/medium trad gear and 2 bolts (read above).

Per

Jared Fehr

: as of 4/4/19, there were 6 bolts from top to bottom on this route.
content.location:
Per

Thomas Cuthbert

: it is the middle climb of the three bolted routes.

content.description:
Chicken Runner is 5.7 and is equipped with 8 bolts and 2 single ring anchors.

Per

Thomas Cuthbert

: the difficulty varies on which line you pick.
content.location: It is on the right side of this small crag.
